lines.line_text: OFT I've implor'd the Gods in vain,
And pray'd till I've been weary;
For once I'll try my wish to gain
Of Oberon the fairy.

stanzas.stanza_text:
OFT I've implor'd the Gods in vain,
And pray'd till I've been weary;
For once I'll try my wish to gain
Of Oberon the fairy.

lines.line_text: Sweet airy being, wanton sprite,
That lurk'st in woods unseen;
And oft by Cynthia's silver light
Tripst gaily o'er the green!

stanzas.stanza_text:
Sweet airy being, wanton sprite,
That lurk'st in woods unseen;
And oft by Cynthia's silver light
Tripst gaily o'er the green!

lines.line_text: If e'er thy pitying heart was mov'd,
As ancient stories tell,
And for th' Athenian maid, who lov'd,
Thou sought'st a wondrous spell;

stanzas.stanza_text:
If e'er thy pitying heart was mov'd,
As ancient stories tell,
And for th' Athenian maid, who lov'd,
Thou sought'st a wondrous spell;

lines.line_text: Oh! deign once more t' exert thy power;
Haply some herb or tree,
Sov'reign as juice of western flower,
Conceals a balm for me.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oh! deign once more t' exert thy power;
Haply some herb or tree,
Sov'reign as juice of western flower,
Conceals a balm for me.

lines.line_text: I ask no kind return of love,
No tempting charm to please:
Far from the heart those gifts remove,
That sighs for peace and ease.

stanzas.stanza_text:
I ask no kind return of love,
No tempting charm to please:
Far from the heart those gifts remove,
That sighs for peace and ease.

lines.line_text: Nor peace nor ease the heart can know,
Which, like the needle true,
Turns at the touch of joy or woe,
But, turning, trembles too.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Nor peace nor ease the heart can know,
Which, like the needle true,
Turns at the touch of joy or woe,
But, turning, trembles too.

lines.line_text: Far as distress the soul can wound,
'Tis pain in each degree:
'Tis bliss but to a certain bound;
Beyond is agony.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Far as distress the soul can wound,
'Tis pain in each degree:
'Tis bliss but to a certain bound;
Beyond is agony.

lines.line_text: Take then this treacherous sense of mine,
Which dooms me still to smart;
Which pleasure can to pain refine,
To pain new pangs impart.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Take then this treacherous sense of mine,
Which dooms me still to smart;
Which pleasure can to pain refine,
To pain new pangs impart.

lines.line_text: Oh, haste to shed the sacred balm!
My shatter'd nerves new-string;
And for my guest, serenely calm,
The nymph, Indifference bring.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oh, haste to shed the sacred balm!
My shatter'd nerves new-string;
And for my guest, serenely calm,
The nymph, Indifference bring.

lines.line_text: At her approach, see Hope, see Fear,
See Expectation fly;
And Disappointment in the rear,
That blasts the promis'd joy.

stanzas.stanza_text:
At her approach, see Hope, see Fear,
See Expectation fly;
And Disappointment in the rear,
That blasts the promis'd joy.

lines.line_text: The tear, which pity taught to flow,
The eye shall then disown:
The heart that melts for other's woe,
Shall then scarce feel its own.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The tear, which pity taught to flow,
The eye shall then disown:
The heart that melts for other's woe,
Shall then scarce feel its own.

lines.line_text: The wounds which now each moment bleed,
Each moment then shall close,
And tranquil days shall still succeed
To nights of calm repose.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The wounds which now each moment bleed,
Each moment then shall close,
And tranquil days shall still succeed
To nights of calm repose.

lines.line_text: O, fairy elf! but grant me this,
This one kind comfort send;
And so may never-fading bliss
Thy flow'ry paths attend!

stanzas.stanza_text:
O, fairy elf! but grant me this,
This one kind comfort send;
And so may never-fading bliss
Thy flow'ry paths attend!

lines.line_text: So may the glow-worm's glimm'ring light
Thy tiny footsteps lead
To some new region of delight,
Unknown to mortal tread.

stanzas.stanza_text:
So may the glow-worm's glimm'ring light
Thy tiny footsteps lead
To some new region of delight,
Unknown to mortal tread.

lines.line_text: And be thy acorn goblet fill'd
With heav'ns ambrosial dew;
From sweetest, freshest flow'rs distill'd,
That shed fresh sweets for you.

stanzas.stanza_text:
And be thy acorn goblet fill'd
With heav'ns ambrosial dew;
From sweetest, freshest flow'rs distill'd,
That shed fresh sweets for you.

lines.line_text: And what of life remains for me,
I'll pass in sober ease;
Half-pleas'd, contented will I be,
Content but half to please.

stanzas.stanza_text:
And what of life remains for me,
I'll pass in sober ease;
Half-pleas'd, contented will I be,
Content but half to please.
